sentences.sContent: As a Puritan, he is strict in moral and religion.
sentences.sContent_eng: As a Puritan, he is strict in moral and religion.
sentences.sCn: 作为清教徒，他的道德和宗教观念都很严格。

sentences.sContent: They named it after the Puritan minister who willed half his estate and all his books to the college.
sentences.sContent_eng: They named it after the Puritan minister who willed half his estate and all his books to the college.
sentences.sCn: 他们以一位在遗嘱中将半数产业和所有书籍都捐给这所大学的清教徒牧师来为学校命名。

remMethod.val: pur(=pure纯洁) + itan → 讲究道德纯洁 → 清教徒

trans.tranOther: The Puritans were a group of English Protestants in the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries who lived in a very strict and religious way
